newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's H1 gold imports, exports rise yr-on-yr.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's H1 gold imports, exports rise yr-on-yr.

text.p: South Korea's gold imports surged 25.6 percent to 304 tonnes for the first six months of this year from 242 tonnes in the same period last year, an official with the central Bank of Korea said on Friday.
The official said the country's exports for the first half rose 23.9 percent to 285 tonnes from 230 tonnes a year earlier.

In value terms, imports of the period totalled $3.40 billion, compared to $3.08 billion a year ago. Exports of the first six months totalled $3.16 billion, compared to $2.91 billion a year earlier, the official said.
Traders said the rise in gold trade was mainly due to increasing bullion transshipment trade, helped by stable foreign exchange rates during the period.
They said the gold trade had temporarily decreased early this year due to the won's weakness against the dollar.
Last July, South Korea cracked down on booming bullion transshipment trade by shortening the deferred-payment period to a maximum of 30 days from 120 days.

Bullion houses had imported huge amounts of gold on 90-day deferred payments, then immediately exported the yellow metal and parked the proceeds in high interest-bearing domestic money market instruments.
They reaped huge profits from arbitrage between local interest rates of more than 11 percent and London Interbank Offered Rates of around five percent.
